poem:
**Curiosities Shop**

In the dim light of Essex,  
beneath a bowler hat,  
a man with dreadlocked whispers  
curates the unthinkable—  
skulls conversational as teacups,  
bones that echo old dances.  
Ethically sourced, he claims,  
as if morality were a currency,  
while the past breathes  
gently from glass cases.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s gruesome’: fears of grave-robbing amid rise in sale of human remains “When it comes to human stuff, I’ll take anything, pretty much,” says Henry Scragg. “As long as it’s been ethically sourced, may I add.” Speaking from his macabre curiosities shop in Essex in a recent YouTube interview, Scragg wears a shabby bowler hat, has tribal-style face tattoos and a ginger beard that descends into three pendulous dreadlocks. The shop, Curiosities from the 5th". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘It’s gruesome’: fears of grave-robbing amid rise in sale of human remains “When it comes to human stuff, I’ll take anything, pretty much,” says Henry Scragg. “As long as it’s been ethically sourced, may I add.” Speaking from his macabre curiosities shop in Essex in a recent YouTube interview, Scragg wears a shabby bowler hat, has tribal-style face tattoos and a ginger beard that descends into three pendulous dreadlocks. The shop, Curiosities from the 5th
